> [idlesong](#comment_6_1L4fuhUB75eAdVbDY9AJ4z2i2dwMho7MV8): Yes, zeronet is awesome. It can't be blocked by the China Great Firewall. While most sites which Chinese can make free speech have been blocked by China Great Firewall.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/gfwtalk.bit/?Topic:17_1GtJqyJRsuZhmxVtw5USgvqGbUmVH7EmBD/+How+the+Great+Firewall+discovers+hidden+circumvention+servers

> [idlesong](#comment_8_1L4fuhUB75eAdVbDY9AJ4z2i2dwMho7MV8): Zeronet is a p2p network, I think it's different than normal hidden circumvention servers. In other words, Zeronet has a lot of hidden circumvention servers. Block all the Zeronet servers will be a big cost for GFW.

u are correct even if the GFW know u connected to a tor server after you got the files they need to go and shut down or stop every connection zeronet users make in china
for that reason in my opinion people should never use optional files for chinese content because the files needs to cross the GFW only once buy if files are optionals the files need to cross the GFW every time

54_1GtJqyJRsuZhmxVtw5USgvqGbUmVH7EmBD.body:
> [zerro](#comment_3_17eKk6mdR7bth2Fi8f74P5JV8AfHsERT4F): Need to implement a feature: downloading random optional files, and not all. And settings like 
> 
> but

well i was thinking about placing sub folders on other zsite and zeronet to link them

> [bot](#comment_30_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb): but can't load content in a cross-domain way. then the load should be based on hash from content.json, zeronet should replace all links in html with the hash of the file so this file `http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MAGfvwa3626prhVFmYCkSfxQzW6ZePBMN/gdb.voanews.com/058DB539-2C69-4FB8-8C0B-AB2897229E37_w443_h249.jpg` in html is `` in html should be replaced with this `adb275a424ed1481e96012cf499907895c2da4969f57bc15aa87d415f4b938dc` . `jpg`(?) from here ``` }, "gdb.voanews.com/058DB539-2C69-4FB8-8C0B-AB2897229E37_w443_h249.jpg": { "sha512": "adb275a424ed1481e96012cf499907895c2da4969f57bc15aa87d415f4b938dc", "size": 25099 ``` this will allow to place the content what ever you want because domains are irrelevant you only care about the hash this will kinda allow me to place all the jpg on another zsite put this jpg dedicated zsite on a server compute the hash again of all jpg, the hash will be the same so will be ok, this will be something like content delivering netowork for zeronet

> [bot](#comment_31_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb): That would be a clever way to implement it. 

it will require a filename-to-hash redirect module build around the content.json file

> [noiamo](#comment_56_14XxpXNGMLsyeQxikacrbQnAFXVyhN5Ngx): Maybe open an issue on github

github is not censorship resistant

> [nofish](#comment_623_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): > because peers groupped by site address and not by content hash.

so we need to re-donwnload zerotalk files(css, js, img) for the english, chinese, spanish, etc  even if those files are already in another local folder ?

if that is true there is room for optimization

> [nofish](#comment_624_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): yes (we are talking about ~400kb), if we want to find files by hash then it will need ~5kb/hour network communication for every file + ~50kb memory overhead also per file (to store the peers)so i highly doubt it would worth it

then how you deal with duplicate files ? (and why should we use zeronet when there is IPFS)

> [nofish](#comment_627_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj):  would add security problems 

nah the file or has the hash required or does not have the hash required, there is no way to fake sha512

> [nofish](#comment_625_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): You should use IPFS if you prefer that way.

defensive much ?

> [nofish](#comment_628_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): 
>Local de-duplication plugin also could be possible. (if you already downloaded the same file from other site don't re-download again, but make a copy/hardlink of it)

that exactly the point, 
1. have a duplicates folder 
1. when a site over 10 MB require more disk space just compare content.json files from the local zsites 
1. put the original file into duplicate folder using the hash like filename 
1. make symbolic links to the other folders using the names from content.json files
